article.title: Private peer-to-peer
article.text:
{{fsb}}

'''Private peer-to-peer''' (P2P) systems are [[peer-to-peer]] (P2P) systems that allow only mutually trusted peers to participate. This can be achieved by using a central server such as a [[Direct Connect (file sharing)#Hubs|Direct Connect hub]] to authenticate clients. Alternatively, users can exchange [[password]]s or [[key (cryptography)|cryptographic keys]] with friends to form a decentralized network. Private peer-to-peer systems can be divided into [[friend-to-friend]] (F2F) and group-based systems. Friend-to-friend systems only allow connections between users who know one another, but may also provide automatic anonymous forwarding. Group-based systems allow any user to connect to any other, and thus they cannot grow in size without compromising their users' privacy. Some software, such as [[WASTE]], can be configured to create either group-based or F2F networks.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Barroso|first=Ana|last2=Hollick|first2=Matthias|date=2015|title=Performance evaluation of delay-tolerant wireless friend-to-friend networks for undetectable communication|url=http://dx.doi.org/10.1109/lcn.2015.7366356|journal=2015 IEEE 40th Conference on Local Computer Networks (LCN)|publisher=IEEE|volume=|pages=|doi=10.1109/lcn.2015.7366356|isbn=9781467367707|via=}}</ref>

==Software list==
*[[Direct Connect (file sharing)|Direct Connect]] - file sharing and chat using private hubs
*[[GigaTribe]] - a private community-oriented file-sharing program
*[[Retroshare]] - a private F2F system based on PGP, implementing [[Turtle F2F]] file sharing.

The following software titles have been discontinued.
*Infinit - file sharing app with local encryption based on research made at the [[University of Cambridge]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Towards a worldwide storage infrastructure|author=Julien Quintard|date=12 June 2012|url=http://www.dspace.cam.ac.uk/handle/1810/243442|accessdate=18 January 2015 }}</ref>
*[[Madster]] (formerly Aimster) - early P2P software that used a buddy list to restrict sharing
*[[Microsoft Office Groove|Groove]] - a corporate [[groupware]] software based on P2P technology
*[[n2n]] - a peer-to-peer [[VPN]] software
*[[Turtle F2F]] - instant messaging and file sharing with private connections only
*[[WASTE]] - private P2P software suitable for groups of 10 to 50 users

==See also==
*[[Friend-to-friend]]
*[[Darknet]]
*[[LAN messenger]]

==References==
{{Reflist}}
*[http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/summary?doi=10.1.1.101.921 How to disappear completely: A survey of private peer-to-peer networks.] SPACE 2007 workshop, July 2007. 
*[http://www.furorteutonicus.eu/2012/02/25/comparison-of-p2p-file-sharing-tools-for-lan-parties/ Comparison of P2P file sharing tools for LAN parties.]
